result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard L Alva was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court sentenced defendant to a total of 5 years WSP consecutive to any other sentence.  Two and one-half years initial confinement and two and one-half years extended supervision. Court find the defendant IS NOT ELIGIBLE for CIP or the WSAP programs.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may no longer use or possess any firearms 
or body armor, also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored
Restitution set at -0- zero.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard L Alva

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DOC Refund Packets
Bail Refund Packets
Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (30 pages) commencing MARCH 5, 2015 received and filed. kl
Notice sent to surety on 03/10/15.

Defendant Richard L Alva in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements by: Lisa-Marie F. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 5 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 1/2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 1/2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 1 day.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 3/5/2020; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 3/5/2020; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his  civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Richard L Alva in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defense has received discovery and needs time to review it with the defendant.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Richard L Alva in court with attorney James E Toran.  Megan M Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.  
The Court ordered no possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Richard L Alva in court with attorney James E Toran.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
